content_parts.content:
When journal entries for sales and purchase invoices and credit notes, sales shipments, purchase receipts, sales returns, purchase returns and stock issues do not transfer successfully to Sage Intacct due to incorrect attribute and dimension assignments, you can correct the assignments on the original documents. On the Notification history page, you can access the source document and make corrections as needed.

After making corrections, you can resend the document.

You can map more than 1000 documents when you select one of the create all actions.
This applies to the Sage Intacct Mapping page.

A stock value adjustment from a purchase credit note value that is different from the original purchase receipt value for an item generates journal entry lines. The journal entry is sent to your financial solution.

Financial information for reporting, forecasting and auditing purposes remain complete, accurate and up-to-date.

content_parts.title: US: Customer and supplier tax IDs not required

content_parts.content: A tax ID is not required for US suppliers, customers and business entities.

content_parts.title: Notes on sales invoices and credit notes; display the item ID on Purchase order line inquiry

content_parts.content:
• You can add internal and external notes to sales invoices and sales credit notes.
  • On the Purchase order line inquiry page, you can display the Item ID column by selecting it from the Open panel column icon.

content_parts.title: Print paid amounts from Sage Intacct

content_parts.content:
When an accounts receivable advance is created and applied to an accounts receivable invoice in Sage Intacct, the sales invoice in Sage Intacct Manufacturing can be printed with the payment information.

If the Update amount paid on sales document reports is active for a company, sales invoices and sales credit notes include the updated amount paid when printed.
You can manage sales quotes on the Sales order page using the Quote status, which replaces the Draft status. You can also print a quote and send it by email to the customer.

For Purchasing: Buy-to-order

  • You can create a purchase order from a sales order for an item that is replenished as a purchased Buy-to-order item.
  • Buy-to-order items are allocated to the sales order line when received into stock from a Purchase receipt.

For Manufacturing: Make-to-order

  • A Production tracking allocates stock to a sales order line if the work order was created from a sales order.

Use categories to run reports by category and/or analyse grouped data. When an item, supplier or customer is added to a category, that information displays on their respective pages.

  • Define categories to group items by category such as allergens or hazards.
  • Define shared or individual categories for suppliers and customers.

content_parts.title: Actions on Purchasing and Sales pages moved to top

content_parts.content: On Purchasing and Sales pages, you can access standard actions like Duplicate, Delete or Print from the top of each page.

Group lines in the main list by columns representing a fixed choice, such as status or date, or columns that represent another record.

When you select Group by this column next to a column title, the list displays the lines nested by group. You can expand each group to view all the lines in the group.

Grouping is not saved when you navigate away from the page.

content_parts.title: Main list enhancements for Purchasing and Sales

content_parts.content:
The main list on Purchasing and Sales pages are easier to work with:

  • Sort documents by number and date.
  • Number, date and status columns always display.
  • Check marks easily identify sent or printed documents.
  • Amounts and quantities include currency and unit symbols.
  • Select the document number to see full details.
